com.stormpath.sdk.idsite

Interface IdSiteCallbackHandler


  • public interface IdSiteCallbackHandler
    Handles HTTP replies sent from your ID Site to your application's callbackUri, for example, https://awesomeapp.com/id, and returns an AccountResult.

    Usage example is documented in application.newIdSiteUrlBuilder().

    Since:
    1.0.RC2
    See Also:
    Application.newIdSiteCallbackHandler(Object), setNonceStore(NonceStore), getAccountResult()

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AccountResult getAccountResult()
      Actually processes the request and returns an AccountResult object that reflects the account that logged in or registered.
      void setNonceStore(NonceStore nonceStore)
      Sets a NonceStore that will retain ID Site message identifiers as nonces, eliminating Replay Attacks.

    • Method Detail

      • setNonceStore

        void setNonceStore(NonceStore nonceStore)
        Sets a NonceStore that will retain ID Site message identifiers as nonces, eliminating Replay Attacks. This ensures any ID Site messages cannot be intercepted and used again later.

        Because this ensures strong security, a NonceStore is enabled by default IF you have caching enabled for the SDK: a cache region will be used to store nonces over time, and those nonces will be used to assert that ID Site replies are not used more than once.

        Default NonceStore

        As mentioned above, a Cache-based NonceStore is enabled by default if you have caching enabled in the SDK. Because nonces are stored in a cache region, it is very important to ensure that the nonce store cache region has an entry TTL longer than the response message valid life span. For Stormpath, response messages are valid for 1 minute, so your default cache region settings must use a TTL longer than 1 minute (most caching system defaults are ~ 30 minutes or an hour, so odds are high that you're 'ok').

        Custom Nonce Store

        If you have not enabled caching in the SDK, or you don't want to use your SDK cache as a NonceStore, you can specify a custom instance via this method, and all ID Site reply identifiers will be stored there to prevent reuse, but note: your custom NonceStore implementation MUST support the notion of a TTL (Time-to-Live) and automatically evict entries older than the max age lifespan (again, 1 minute).

        If your NonceStore implementation does not support TTL auto-eviction, your store will fill up indefinitely, likely causing storage errors.

        Parameters:
        nonceStore - the NonceStore implementation to use during the process to execute this request.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the nonceStore argument is null.

      • getAccountResult

        AccountResult getAccountResult()
        Actually processes the request and returns an AccountResult object that reflects the account that logged in or registered.
        Returns:
        the resolved identity in the form of an AccountResult
